channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kidnapper Who Held Elizabeth Smart Captive for 9 Months Arrested After Police Say Sex Offender Visited Salt Lake City Parks
President Trump reportedly considering executive order limiting NIL after meeting with Nick Saban
Cops hunt for killer after Arizona pastor, 76, is found murdered on his bed with his hands pinned to the wall
Videotaped woman whose racial slurs against child went viral raises $300k online
Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO is ruled unfit for trial and ordered hospitalized
5/2: CBS Evening News
item.description: Diner owner feeling the pinch as costs rise and customers cut back; Hundreds form a human chain to move a Michigan bookstore by hand

item.title: Trump admin live updates: White House backtracks on renaming Veterans Day
item.description: The White House is backtracking after President Donald Trump said in a social media post that he was renaming Veterans Day.

item.title: Pirates fan who fell over wall at PNC Park identified as young man who "made a lasting impact on the South Allegheny community"
item.description: Kavan Markwood is the fan​ who fell from the 21-foot Clemente Wall in right field at PNC Park in Pittsburgh on Wednesday.

item.title: RFK Jr. unveils 'radical' change to vaccine testing
item.description: A Department of Health and Human Services spokesperson called the move "a radical departure from past practices."

item.title: Why some Texas residents are wary of Elon Musk's potential SpaceX town
item.description: Elon Musk’s SpaceX already has a footprint in South Texas but now wants to create an official municipality for the launch site called Starbase.

item.title: 2 wounded in shooting at Spartan College in Inglewood; suspect in custody
item.description: Two of the victims were believed to be female employees of the college, Inglewood's mayor told CBS News Los Angeles.

item.title: Department of Justice suing Colorado, Denver over "sanctuary" policies
item.description: The Department of Justice has filed a lawsuit against the state of Colorado, the city of Denver and a list of local leaders.

item.title: Denver oldest serving fire station home to first Black firefighters
item.description: Serving the community meant clearing racial hurdles. And sometimes entailed paying the highest price in the line of duty.

item.title: 2 women shot on campus of small technical college near Los Angeles
item.description: The mayor of a Southern California city says two women have been shot on a college campus and taken to the hospital

item.title: Iranian students at the University of Alabama say immigration crackdown echoes repression at home
item.description: Alireza Doroudi has been detained in an immigration facility in Louisiana for nearly six weeks. Doroudi’s detention has instilled fear in the small Ir...

item.title: Trump can't drop funding for NPR, PBS, group says
item.description: The nonprofit corporation overseeing National Public Radio and the Public Broadcasting Service is firing back at President Donald Trump's executive or...

item.title: In the wake of devastating Los Angeles fires, residents begin to rebuild
NYPD shared a Palestinian protester’s info with ICE. Now it’s evidence in her deportation case
